title: WTB: Shredded, Ripped, Mangled T206 Beaters
author: drazz5

posts.post_title: WTB: Shredded, Ripped, Mangled T206 Beaters
posts.post_content:
Hi All,

I am working on a new art installation for my office that I am hoping can combine my interests in art and t206 collecting. I do not have much of a collecting appetite for the chewed up, half-card pieces that some people have in their possession, but I do still think the artwork is unique and can be displayed in a way that can be appreciated, regardless of condition. 

That being said, I am looking to buy whatever torn up, chopped up, hole punched, ugly tobacco cards you may have lying around (for a reasonable price). While torn up is a plus, I would still like to look at cards with relatively bold colors if possible. If the card is particularly worthless, I will also gladly accept donations of any kind as well. 

The goal is to create some sort of abstract, 3D paper collage installation that can be hung in our office lobby. Still working out the design details, but I wanted to provide a disclaimer: However the cards are displayed, they will not be glued or applied with any other adhesive (I want to protect the integrity of the card, regardless of how torn up it already is). 

Excited to see where this project goes - appreciate anyone willing to help out!

also, if anyone has this card, happy to make it the centerpiece of the display. 

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=616088&d=1711651437[/IMG]

I have received a few donations or contributions in the last few weeks, so I wanted to provide my first progress post, albeit modest. 

Since my original post, I have decided on a color scheme for the collage (see below). I think this will give my efforts a little more focus and give me a better chance of creating something that is actually visually appealing. The 2nd photo is the cards I have obtained so far. Starting to see a color palette take shape. I am still looking to buy (especially red and yellow beaters) and will of course accept donations for those so inclined. Thanks for looking!

Shoutout to the guys below that have helped me with this fun project so far. Appreciate it!!

Craig Martin (lunker21)
Mike Mullins (Mullinsm)
Jason (jggames)

Sent from my SM-G975U1 using Tapatalk
As was I! I have been pretty lucky so far. Also, A lot of them have backs that are totally destroyed, which is perfect for what I need since I only care about the visuals of the front.
Awesome! Can't wait to see it take shape!
